author: Special Correspondent
text:
250 stalls will display different products

The MADITSSIA’s 30{+t}{+h}All India Ideal Home Exhibition is to begin at Tamukkum Grounds here on February 19. It will remain open till February 28.

Speaking to reporters, MADITSSIA president L. Murari and exhibition chairman V.S. Manimaran said that 250 stalls would display different products in eight exclusive bays.

From kitchenware to furniture, readymade garments to modern computers and all home appliances would be exhibited under one roof.

The expo will have stalls from nationalised and private banks offering home loans, among other products. As a special attraction, a pavilion called — Snow World — is being installed at the expo. This is expected to draw a huge crowd as it would give a real experience of stepping into a place surrounded by snow.

Model smart city

Similarly, efforts are being made to build a model smart city, which would explain the features of a smart city.

The model would help build an idea on the need to keep our city clean and green, the organisers said.

Leading brands from food industry would be participating and offering very many contests daily for the public. Corporate houses and commercial establishments would be conducting lucky draw contest in which prizes, including two-wheeler and gold jewellery, would be presented to winners.

On all weekends, the expo would be open from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. and on weekdays from 4 p.m. to 9 p.m. Minister ‘Sellur’ K. Raju, Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa and Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao would inaugurate the expo.
title: Ideal Home Expo to begin on Friday
